summary: Test Case CSV file is used for importing and exporting test case metadata. Users can export test cases at table level, test suite level, or platform-wide.

headers.name: name
headers.description: Name that identifies the test case.

headers.name: displayName
headers.description: Display name that identifies this test case.

headers.name: description
headers.description: Description for the test case in Markdown format.
examples: This test case validates that the table row count is within the expected range.

headers.name: testDefinition
headers.description: Fully qualified name of the test definition.

headers.name: entityFQN
headers.description: Fully qualified name of the entity (table or column) being tested. For table tests use table FQN, for column tests use column FQN.

headers.name: testSuite
headers.description: Fully qualified name of the test suite. If not provided, the default basic test suite for the entity will be used.

headers.name: parameterValues
headers.description: Parameter values for the test case in JSON format. Each parameter is defined as {"name":"paramName","value":value}. Multiple parameters are separated by ';'.

headers.name: computePassedFailedRowCount
headers.description: Flag to indicate if the test should compute passed and failed row counts. Valid values: true, false.

headers.name: useDynamicAssertion
headers.description: Flag to indicate if the test uses dynamic assertion. Valid values: true, false.

headers.name: inspectionQuery
headers.description: SQL query for inspecting failed test results.

headers.name: tags
headers.description: Fully qualified classification tag names associated with the test case separated by ';'.

headers.name: glossaryTerms
headers.description: Fully qualified glossary term names associated with the test case separated by ';'.
